node.title: Bangladesh frustrate Blackcaps with dominant day two showing in first test
node.description: The tourists are just 153-runs behind New Zealand's first-innings total with eight wickets in hand.
node.content: ["Bangladesh have frustrated and outplayed the Blackcaps on day two of the first test at Mount Maunganui's Bay Oval.", "The Tigers cleaned up New Zealand's middle and lower order on Sunday morning, dismissing the hosts for 328 - taking 5/70 on day two.", "Following that, Bangladeshi's top order stifled the World Test Championship-winning attack to end 175/2 at the close of play.", "That leaves the tourists just 153 runs behind the Blackcaps on a flat wicket, with an opportunity on Monday to push towards a first-ever test win on New Zealand soil.", "Henry Nicholls was the batting highlight for the Blackcaps on Sunday, last man out for 75 - scoring a 12th test match half-century in the process.", "Rachin Ravindra fell for four in the fourth over of the day - dismissed by impressive left-arm seamer Shoriful Islam who finished with 3/69.", "But it was off-spin bowling that cleaned up the tail, with Mehidy Hasan taking 3/86, claiming the wickets of Kyle Jamieson, Neil Wagner and Tim Southee.", "Captain Mominul Islam took the wicket of Nicholls to end the New Zealand innings that midway through the final session on Saturday was 189/2.", "Recent history suggested the vaunted Blackcaps attack would run through a Bangladeshi batting lineup more at home on turning, slow wickets, but openers Shadman Islam and Mahmudul Hasan Joy coasted through the opening spells of Tim Southee, Trent Bould and Kyle Jamieson.", "But as always, lion-hearted Neil Wagner posed a different challenge and the fiery left-armer broke the partnership, scooping up a smart catch off his own bowling to dismiss Shadman (22).", "And Wagner should have had a second wicket an over later when he appeared to trap Joy in front, but umpire Chris Brown said no, and Wagner and his teammates decided against reviewing, believing the batsman had edged the ball onto his pad.\u00a0", "But replays showed the ball only hit pad and was crashing into middle stump and Joy would make the Blackcaps pay, scoring a maiden half-century and will resume tomorrow 70 not out in a near five-hour stay at the crease.", "Wagner did have success late in the day breaking a 103-run partnership between Joy and Najmul Shanto (64) when Will Young took a smart catch in the gully to send the latter back to the sheds.", "Captain Mominul and Joy survived a few scares in the final hour - including a dropped catch by Nicholls - a tough chance off Southee that would have dismissed Mominul (8)."]
